main_definition: To move or convey from one place, person, or thing to another.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To move data from one computer system or storage device to another.
meanings_and_examples.example: I will transfer the files from my old laptop to a new external hard drive.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To change control of an asset, like money or property, from one person/entity to another.
meanings_and_examples.example: She decided to transfer ownership of her house to her children upon her retirement.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To hand over responsibility for something to someone else.
meanings_and_examples.example: The manager will transfer the project management duties to his assistant during his vacation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In sports, to pass or kick a ball from one player to another teammate.
meanings_and_examples.example: During the soccer game, he made a perfect transfer of the ball to his forward.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To move oneself from one location to another physically.
meanings_and_examples.example: After finishing work, I transferred my belongings from home to my new office.
